title: A Slap In The Face For Ordinary People (With Mary Foy MP)
itunes:title: A Slap In The Face For Ordinary People (With Mary Foy MP)
description:
As a number of enquiries get under way into the Greensill lobbying scandal, a senior Tory backbencher has warned the impression of cronyism and corruption could damage Conservative support, especially in the "Red Wall" former Labour areas in the north.


Mary Foy, Labour MP for the City of Durham, tells Bloomberg Westminster's Caroline Hepker and Roger Hearing the scandal slaps right in the face of "levelling-up", and claims some politicians have also been making millions out of the pandemic.


Bloomberg's David Hellier joins to discuss the plans for a football "super-league" involving Europe's top teams, and the anger they have produced from fans and politicians.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

Mary Foy, Labour MP for the City of Durham, tells Bloomberg Westminster's Caroline Hepker and Roger Hearing the scandal slaps right in the face of "levelling-up", and claims some politicians have also been making millions out of the pandemic.
